description: Use the chrome.bookmarks API to create, organize, and otherwise manipulate bookmarks. Also see Override Pages, which you can use to create a custom Bookmark Manager page.

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is created.
events.name: onCreated

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is removed.  When a folder is removed recursively, a single notification is fired for the folder, and none for its contents.
events.name: onRemoved

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder changes. Note: Currently, only title and url changes trigger this.
events.name: onChanged

events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is moved to a different parent folder.
events.name: onMoved

events.description: Fired when the children of a folder have changed their order due to the order being sorted in the UI.  This is not called as a result of a move().
events.name: onChildrenReordered

events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is begun.  Expensive observers should ignore onCreated updates until onImportEnded is fired.  Observers should still handle other notifications immediately.
events.name: onImportBegan

events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is ended.
events.name: onImportEnded

functions.description: Retrieves the specified BookmarkTreeNode(s).
functions.name: get

parameters.description: A single string-valued id, or an array of string-valued ids
parameters.name: idOrIdList

functions.description: Retrieves the children of the specified BookmarkTreeNode id.
functions.name: getChildren

functions.description: Retrieves the recently added bookmarks.
functions.name: getRecent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: numberOfItems

functions.description: Retrieves the entire Bookmarks hierarchy.
functions.name: getTree

functions.description: Retrieves part of the Bookmarks hierarchy, starting at the specified node.
functions.name: getSubTree

parameters.description: The ID of the root of the subtree to retrieve.
parameters.name: id

functions.description: Searches for BookmarkTreeNodes matching the given query. Queries specified with an object produce BookmarkTreeNodes matching all specified properties.
functions.name: search

choices.description: A string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles.
An object specifying properties and values to match when searching. Produces bookmarks matching all properties.

query.description: A string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles.

title.description: The title of the bookmark; matches verbatim.

url.description: The URL of the bookmark; matches verbatim. Note that folders have no URL.

parameters.description: Either a string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles, or an object. If an object, the properties query, url, and title may be specified and bookmarks matching all specified properties will be produced.
parameters.name: query

functions.description: Creates a bookmark or folder under the specified parentId.  If url is NULL or missing, it will be a folder.
functions.name: create

functions.description: Moves the specified BookmarkTreeNode to the provided location.
functions.name: move

functions.description: Updates the properties of a bookmark or folder. Specify only the properties that you want to change; unspecified properties will be left unchanged. Note: Currently, only 'title' and 'url' are supported.
functions.name: update

functions.description: Removes a bookmark or an empty bookmark folder.
functions.name: remove

functions.description: Recursively removes a bookmark folder.
functions.name: removeTree

functions.description: Imports bookmarks from a chrome html bookmark file
functions.name: import

functions.description: Exports bookmarks to a chrome html bookmark file
functions.name: export

MAX_SUSTAINED_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MINUT.deprecated: Bookmark write operations are no longer limited by Chrome.

MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_HOUR.deprecated: Bookmark write operations are no longer limited by Chrome.

types.description: Indicates the reason why this node is unmodifiable. The <var>managed</var> value indicates that this node was configured by the system administrator or by the custodian of a supervised user. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).
A node (either a bookmark or a folder) in the bookmark tree.  Child nodes are ordered within their parent folder.

children.description: An ordered list of children of this node.

dateAdded.description: When this node was created, in milliseconds since the epoch (new Date(dateAdded)).

dateGroupModified.description: When the contents of this folder last changed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the browser is restarted.

index.description: The 0-based position of this node within its parent folder.

parentId.description: The id of the parent folder. Omitted for the root node.

title.description: The text displayed for the node.

unmodifiable.description: Indicates the reason why this node is unmodifiable. The <var>managed</var> value indicates that this node was configured by the system administrator or by the custodian of a supervised user. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).

url.description: The URL navigated to when a user clicks the bookmark. Omitted for folders.

types.description: Object passed to the create() function.

parentId.description: Defaults to the Other Bookmarks folder.

description: Use browser actions to put icons in the main Google Chrome toolbar, to the right of the address bar. In addition to its icon, a browser action can also have a tooltip, a badge, and a popup.

events.description: Fired when a browser action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the browser action has a popup.
events.name: onClicked

functions.description: Sets the title of the browser action. This shows up in the tooltip.
functions.name: setTitle

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

title.description: The string the browser action should display when moused over.

functions.description: Gets the title of the browser action.
functions.name: getTitle

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the title from. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific title is returned.

functions.description: Sets the icon for the browser action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.
functions.name: setIcon

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the browser action's icon.
functions.name: setPopup

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.description: Gets the html document set as the popup for this browser action.
functions.name: getPopup

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the popup from. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific popup is returned.

functions.description: Sets the badge text for the browser action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.
functions.name: setBadgeText

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

functions.description: Gets the badge text of the browser action. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge text is returned.
functions.name: getBadgeText

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the badge text from. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge text is returned.

functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.
functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor

color.description: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.description: Gets the background color of the browser action.
functions.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the badge background color from. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge background color is returned.

functions.description: Enables the browser action for a tab. By default, browser actions are enabled.
functions.name: enable

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the browser action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Disables the browser action for a tab.
functions.name: disable

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the browser action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Opens the extension popup window in the active window but does not grant tab permissions.
functions.name: openPopup

parameters.description: JavaScript 'window' object for the popup window if it was succesfully opened.
parameters.name: popupView

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

description: Use the chrome.browsingData API to remove browsing data from a user's local profile.

functions.description: Reports which types of data are currently selected in the 'Clear browsing data' settings UI.  Note: some of the data types included in this API are not available in the settings UI, and some UI settings control more than one data type listed here.
functions.name: settings

dataRemovalPermitted.description: All of the types will be present in the result, with values of true if they are permitted to be removed (e.g., by enterprise policy) and false if not.

dataToRemove.description: All of the types will be present in the result, with values of true if they are both selected to be removed and permitted to be removed, otherwise false.

functions.description: Clears various types of browsing data stored in a user's profile.
functions.name: remove

parameters.description: The set of data types to remove.
parameters.name: dataToRemove

parameters.description: Called when deletion has completed.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears websites' appcache data.
functions.name: removeAppcache

parameters.description: Called when websites' appcache data has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears the browser's cache.
functions.name: removeCache

parameters.description: Called when the browser's cache has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears the browser's cookies and server-bound certificates modified within a particular timeframe.
functions.name: removeCookies

parameters.description: Called when the browser's cookies and server-bound certificates have been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears the browser's list of downloaded files (not the downloaded files themselves).
functions.name: removeDownloads

parameters.description: Called when the browser's list of downloaded files has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears websites' file system data.
functions.name: removeFileSystems

parameters.description: Called when websites' file systems have been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears the browser's stored form data (autofill).
functions.name: removeFormData

parameters.description: Called when the browser's form data has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears the browser's history.
functions.name: removeHistory

parameters.description: Called when the browser's history has cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears websites' IndexedDB data.
functions.name: removeIndexedDB

parameters.description: Called when websites' IndexedDB data has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears websites' local storage data.
functions.name: removeLocalStorage

parameters.description: Called when websites' local storage has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears plugins' data.
functions.name: removePluginData

parameters.description: Called when plugins' data has been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears the browser's stored passwords.
functions.name: removePasswords

parameters.description: Called when the browser's passwords have been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Clears websites' WebSQL data.
functions.name: removeWebSQL

parameters.description: Called when websites' WebSQL databases have been cleared.
parameters.name: callback

types.description: Options that determine exactly what data will be removed.

originTypes.description: An object whose properties specify which origin types ought to be cleared. If this object isn't specified, it defaults to clearing only "unprotected" origins. Please ensure that you really want to remove application data before adding 'protectedWeb' or 'extensions'.

extension.description: Extensions and packaged applications a user has installed (be _really_ careful!).

protectedWeb.description: Websites that have been installed as hosted applications (be careful!).

since.description: Remove data accumulated on or after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch (accessible via the getTime method of the JavaScript Date object). If absent, defaults to 0 (which would remove all browsing data).

types.description: A set of data types. Missing data types are interpreted as false.

cache.description: The browser's cache. Note: when removing data, this clears the entire cache: it is not limited to the range you specify.

description: Use the commands API to add keyboard shortcuts that trigger actions in your extension, for example, an action to open the browser action or send a command to the extension.

events.description: Fired when a registered command is activated using a keyboard shortcut.
events.name: onCommand

functions.description: Returns all the registered extension commands for this extension and their shortcut (if active).
functions.name: getAll

parameters.description: Called to return the registered commands.
parameters.name: callback

name.description: The name of the Extension Command

shortcut.description: The shortcut active for this command, or blank if not active.

description: Use the chrome.contentSettings API to change settings that control whether websites can use features such as cookies, JavaScript, and plugins. More generally speaking, content settings allow you to customize Chrome's behavior on a per-site basis instead of globally.

automaticDownloads.description:
Whether to allow sites to download multiple files automatically. One of
allow: Allow sites to download multiple files automatically,
block: Don't allow sites to download multiple files automatically,
ask: Ask when a site wants to download files automatically after the first file.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

camera.description:
Whether to allow sites to access the camera. One of
allow: Allow sites to access the camera,
block: Don't allow sites to access the camera,
ask: Ask when a site wants to access the camera.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested camera access. The secondary URL is not used.
NOTE: The 'allow' setting is not valid if both patterns are ''.

cookies.description:
Whether to allow cookies and other local data to be set by websites. One of
allow: Accept cookies,
block: Block cookies,
session_only: Accept cookies only for the current session.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL representing the cookie origin. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame.

fullscreen.description:
Whether to allow sites to toggle the fullscreen mode. One of
allow: Allow sites to toggle the fullscreen mode,
ask: Ask when a site wants to toggle the fullscreen mode.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested to toggle the fullscreen mode. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame (which may or may not differ from the requesting URL).

images.description:
Whether to show images. One of
allow: Show images,
block: Don't show images.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is the URL of the image.

javascript.description:
Whether to run JavaScript. One of
allow: Run JavaScript,
block: Don't run JavaScript.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

location.description:
Whether to allow Geolocation. One of
allow: Allow sites to track your physical location,
block: Don't allow sites to track your physical location,
ask: Ask before allowing sites to track your physical location.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested location data. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame (which may or may not differ from the requesting URL).

microphone.description:
Whether to allow sites to access the microphone. One of
allow: Allow sites to access the microphone,
block: Don't allow sites to access the microphone,
ask: Ask when a site wants to access the microphone.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested microphone access. The secondary URL is not used.
NOTE: The 'allow' setting is not valid if both patterns are ''.

mouselock.description:
Whether to allow sites to disable the mouse cursor. One of
allow: Allow sites to disable the mouse cursor,
block: Don't allow sites to disable the mouse cursor,
ask: Ask when a site wants to disable the mouse cursor.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

notifications.description:
Whether to allow sites to show desktop notifications. One of
allow: Allow sites to show desktop notifications,
block: Don't allow sites to show desktop notifications,
ask: Ask when a site wants to show desktop notifications.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which wants to show the notification. The secondary URL is not used.

plugins.description:
Whether to run plugins. One of
allow: Run plugins automatically,
block: Don't run plugins automatically,
detect_important_content: Only run automatically those plugins that are detected as the website's main content.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

popups.description:
Whether to allow sites to show pop-ups. One of
allow: Allow sites to show pop-ups,
block: Don't allow sites to show pop-ups.
Default is block.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

unsandboxedPlugins.description:
Whether to allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed. One of
allow: Allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed,
block: Don't allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed,
ask: Ask when a site wants to run a plugin unsandboxed.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

types.description: The only content type using resource identifiers is $(ref:contentSettings.plugins). For more information, see Resource Identifiers.

description.description: A human readable description of the resource.

id.description: The resource identifier for the given content type.

types.description:
The scope of the ContentSetting. One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular settings).

functions.description: Clear all content setting rules set by this extension.
functions.name: clear

scope.description: Where to clear the setting (default: regular).

functions.description: Gets the current content setting for a given pair of URLs.
functions.name: get

incognito.description: Whether to check the content settings for an incognito session. (default false)

primaryUrl.description: The primary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Note that the meaning of a primary URL depends on the content type.

resourceIdentifier.description: A more specific identifier of the type of content for which the settings should be retrieved.

secondaryUrl.description: The secondary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Defaults to the primary URL. Note that the meaning of a secondary URL depends on the content type, and not all content types use secondary URLs.

setting.description: The content setting. See the description of the individual ContentSetting objects for the possible values.

functions.description: Applies a new content setting rule.
functions.name: set

primaryPattern.description: The pattern for the primary URL. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

resourceIdentifier.description: The resource identifier for the content type.

scope.description: Where to set the setting (default: regular).

secondaryPattern.description: The pattern for the secondary URL. Defaults to matching all URLs. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

setting.description: The setting applied by this rule. See the description of the individual ContentSetting objects for the possible values.

parameters.description: A list of resource identifiers for this content type, or <var>undefined</var> if this content type does not use resource identifiers.
parameters.name: resourceIdentifiers

description: Use the chrome.contextMenus API to add items to Google Chrome's context menu. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

functions.description: Creates a new context menu item. Note that if an error occurs during creation, you may not find out until the creation callback fires (the details will be in chrome.runtime.lastError).
functions.name: create

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio item: true for selected and false for unselected. Only one radio item can be selected at a time in a given group of radio items.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'] if not specified.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Lets you restrict the item to apply only to documents whose URL matches one of the given patterns. (This applies to frames as well.) For details on the format of a pattern, see Match Patterns.

enabled.description: Whether this context menu item is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

id.description: The unique ID to assign to this item. Mandatory for event pages. Cannot be the same as another ID for this extension.

onclick.description: A function that will be called back when the menu item is clicked. Event pages cannot use this; instead, they should register a listener for chrome.contextMenus.onClicked.

parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.
parameters.name: info

parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. Note: this parameter only present for extensions.
parameters.name: tab

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, but lets you filter based on the src attribute of img/audio/video tags and the href of anchor tags.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item; this is required unless type is 'separator'. When the context is 'selection', you can use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

type.description: The type of menu item. Defaults to 'normal' if not specified.

parameters.description: Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in chrome.runtime.lastError.
parameters.name: callback

returns.description: The ID of the newly created item.

functions.description: Updates a previously created context menu item.
functions.name: update

parameters.description: The ID of the item to update.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.
parameters.name: updateProperties

parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. Note: this parameter only present for extensions.
parameters.name: tab

parentId.description: Note: You cannot change an item to be a child of one of its own descendants.

parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been updated.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Removes a context menu item.
functions.name: remove

parameters.description: The ID of the context menu item to remove.
parameters.name: menuItemId

parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been removed.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Removes all context menu items added by this extension.
functions.name: removeAll

parameters.description: Called when removal is complete.
parameters.name: callback

ACTION_MENU_TOP_LEVEL_LIMIT.description: The maximum number of top level extension items that can be added to an extension action context menu. Any items beyond this limit will be ignored.

types.description: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts except for 'launcher'. The 'launcher' context is only supported by apps and is used to add menu items to the context menu that appears when clicking on the app icon in the launcher/taskbar/dock/etc. Different platforms might put limitations on what is actually supported in a launcher context menu.
The type of menu item.

description: Use the chrome.cookies API to query and modify cookies, and to be notified when they change.

events.description: Fired when a cookie is set or removed. As a special case, note that updating a cookie's properties is implemented as a two step process: the cookie to be updated is first removed entirely, generating a notification with "cause" of "overwrite" .  Afterwards, a new cookie is written with the updated values, generating a second notification with "cause" "explicit".
events.name: onChanged

cause.description: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change.

cookie.description: Information about the cookie that was set or removed.

removed.description: True if a cookie was removed.

functions.description: Retrieves information about a single cookie. If more than one cookie of the same name exists for the given URL, the one with the longest path will be returned. For cookies with the same path length, the cookie with the earliest creation time will be returned.
functions.name: get

parameters.description: Details to identify the cookie being retrieved.
parameters.name: details

name.description: The name of the cookie to retrieve.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to look for the cookie. By default, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

url.description: The URL with which the cookie to retrieve is associated. This argument may be a full URL, in which case any data following the URL path (e.g. the query string) is simply ignored. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie. This parameter is null if no such cookie was found.
parameters.name: cookie

functions.description: Retrieves all cookies from a single cookie store that match the given information.  The cookies returned will be sorted, with those with the longest path first.  If multiple cookies have the same path length, those with the earliest creation time will be first.
functions.name: getAll

parameters.description: Information to filter the cookies being retrieved.
parameters.name: details

domain.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose domains match or are subdomains of this one.

path.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose path exactly matches this string.

secure.description: Filters the cookies by their Secure property.

session.description: Filters out session vs. persistent cookies.

storeId.description: The cookie store to retrieve cookies from. If omitted, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

url.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those that would match the given URL.

parameters.description: All the existing, unexpired cookies that match the given cookie info.
parameters.name: cookies

functions.description: Sets a cookie with the given cookie data; may overwrite equivalent cookies if they exist.
functions.name: set

parameters.description: Details about the cookie being set.
parameters.name: details

domain.description: The domain of the cookie. If omitted, the cookie becomes a host-only cookie.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.

httpOnly.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as HttpOnly. Defaults to false.

name.description: The name of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

path.description: The path of the cookie. Defaults to the path portion of the url parameter.

sameSite.description: The cookie's same-site status: defaults to 'no_restriction'.

secure.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as Secure. Defaults to false.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to set the cookie. By default, the cookie is set in the current execution context's cookie store.

url.description: The request-URI to associate with the setting of the cookie. This value can affect the default domain and path values of the created cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

value.description: The value of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie that's been set.  If setting failed for any reason, this will be "null", and "chrome.runtime.lastError" will be set.
parameters.name: cookie

functions.description: Deletes a cookie by name.
functions.name: remove

parameters.description: Information to identify the cookie to remove.
parameters.name: details

name.description: The name of the cookie to remove.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store to look in for the cookie. If unspecified, the cookie is looked for by default in the current execution context's cookie store.

url.description: The URL associated with the cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie that's been removed.  If removal failed for any reason, this will be "null", and "chrome.runtime.lastError" will be set.
parameters.name: details

name.description: The name of the cookie that's been removed.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store from which the cookie was removed.

url.description: The URL associated with the cookie that's been removed.

functions.description: Lists all existing cookie stores.
functions.name: getAllCookieStores

parameters.description: All the existing cookie stores.
parameters.name: cookieStores

types.description: A cookie's 'SameSite' state (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-first-party-cookies). 'no_restriction' corresponds to a cookie set without a 'SameSite' attribute, 'lax' to 'SameSite=Lax', and 'strict' to 'SameSite=Strict'.
Represents information about an HTTP cookie.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Not provided for session cookies.

hostOnly.description: True if the cookie is a host-only cookie (i.e. a request's host must exactly match the domain of the cookie).

httpOnly.description: True if the cookie is marked as HttpOnly (i.e. the cookie is inaccessible to client-side scripts).

sameSite.description: The cookie's same-site status (i.e. whether the cookie is sent with cross-site requests).

secure.description: True if the cookie is marked as Secure (i.e. its scope is limited to secure channels, typically HTTPS).

session.description: True if the cookie is a session cookie, as opposed to a persistent cookie with an expiration date.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store containing this cookie, as provided in getAllCookieStores().

types.description: Represents a cookie store in the browser. An incognito mode window, for instance, uses a separate cookie store from a non-incognito window.

id.description: The unique identifier for the cookie store.

tabIds.description: Identifiers of all the browser tabs that share this cookie store.

types.description: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change. If a cookie was inserted, or removed via an explicit call to "chrome.cookies.remove", "cause" will be "explicit". If a cookie was automatically removed due to expiry, "cause" will be "expired". If a cookie was removed due to being overwritten with an already-expired expiration date, "cause" will be set to "expired_overwrite".  If a cookie was automatically removed due to garbage collection, "cause" will be "evicted".  If a cookie was automatically removed due to a "set" call that overwrote it, "cause" will be "overwrite". Plan your response accordingly.

description: The chrome.debugger API serves as an alternate transport for Chrome's remote debugging protocol. Use chrome.debugger to attach to one or more tabs to instrument network interaction, debug JavaScript, mutate the DOM and CSS, etc. Use the Debuggee tabId to target tabs with sendCommand and route events by tabId from onEvent callbacks.

description: Use the chrome.declarativeContent API to take actions depending on the content of a page, without requiring permission to read the page's content.

types.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageData.
Matches the state of a web page by various criteria.

css.description: Matches if all of the CSS selectors in the array match displayed elements in a frame with the same origin as the page's main frame. All selectors in this array must be compound selectors to speed up matching. Note that listing hundreds of CSS selectors or CSS selectors that match hundreds of times per page can still slow down web sites.

isBookmarked.description: Matches if the bookmarked state of the page is equal to the specified value. Requres the bookmarks permission.

pageUrl.description: Matches if the condition of the UrlFilter are fulfilled for the top-level URL of the page.

types.description: Declarative event action that shows the extension's $(ref:pageAction page action) while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions, but the extension must have a page action. If the extension takes the activeTab permission, a click on the page action will grant access to the active tab.

Declarative event action that sets the n-dip square icon for the extension's $(ref:pageAction page action) or $(ref:browserAction browser action) while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions, but the extension must have page or browser action.

Exactly one of imageData or path must be specified. Both are dictionaries mapping a number of pixels to an image representation. The image representation in imageData is anImageData object, for example from a <canvas> element, while the image representation in path is the path to an image file relative to he extension's manifest. If scale screen pixels fit into a device-independent pixel, the scale * n icon will be used. If that scale is missing, another image will be resized to the needed size.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

types.description:
Declarative event action that injects a content script.

WARNING: This action is still experimental and is not supported on stable builds of Chrome.

allFrames.description: Whether the content script runs in all frames of the matching page, or only the top frame. Default is false.

css.description: Names of CSS files to be injected as a part of the content script.

js.description: Names of Javascript files to be injected as a part of the content script.

matchAboutBlank.description: Whether to insert the content script on about:blank and about:srcdoc. Default is false.

If user didn't select any source (i.e. canceled the prompt) then the callback is called with an empty streamId. The created streamId can be used only once and expires after a few seconds when it is not used.

description: Use the chrome.devtools.inspectedWindow API to interact with the inspected window: obtain the tab ID for the inspected page, evaluate the code in the context of the inspected window, reload the page, or obtain the list of resources within the page.

events.description: Fired when a new resource is added to the inspected page.

parameters.description: New content of the resource.

functions.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression in the context of the main frame of the inspected page. The expression must evaluate to a JSON-compliant object, otherwise an exception is thrown. The eval function can report either a DevTools-side error or a JavaScript exception that occurs during evaluation. In either case, the result parameter of the callback is undefined. In the case of a DevTools-side error, the isException parameter is non-null and has isError set to true and code set to an error code. In the case of a JavaScript error, isException is set to true and value is set to the string value of thrown object.
functions.name: eval

parameters.description: An expression to evaluate.
parameters.name: expression

parameters.description: The options parameter can contain one or more options.
parameters.name: options

contextSecurityOrigin.description: Evaluate the expression in the context of a content script of an extension that matches the specified origin. If given, contextSecurityOrigin overrides the 'true' setting on userContentScriptContext.

frameURL.description: If specified, the expression is evaluated on the iframe whose URL matches the one specified. By default, the expression is evaluated in the top frame of the inspected page.

useContentScriptContext.description: Evaluate the expression in the context of the content script of the calling extension, provided that the content script is already injected into the inspected page. If not, the expression is not evaluated and the callback is invoked with the exception parameter set to an object that has the isError field set to true and the code field set to E_NOTFOUND.

parameters.description: A function called when evaluation completes.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: The result of evaluation.
parameters.name: result

parameters.description: An object providing details if an exception occurred while evaluating the expression.
parameters.name: exceptionInfo

code.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

description.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

details.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated, contains the array of the values that may be substituted into the description string to provide more information about the cause of the error.

isError.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

isException.description: Set if the evaluated code produces an unhandled exception.

value.description: Set if the evaluated code produces an unhandled exception.

functions.description: Reloads the inspected page.
functions.name: reload

ignoreCache.description: When true, the loader will bypass the cache for all inspected page resources loaded before the load event is fired. The effect is similar to pressing Ctrl+Shift+R in the inspected window or within the Developer Tools window.

injectedScript.description: If specified, the script will be injected into every frame of the inspected page immediately upon load, before any of the frame's scripts. The script will not be injected after subsequent reloads—for example, if the user presses Ctrl+R.

userAgent.description: If specified, the string will override the value of the User-Agent HTTP header that's sent while loading the resources of the inspected page. The string will also override the value of the navigator.userAgent property that's returned to any scripts that are running within the inspected page.

types.description: Filters URLs for various criteria. See event filtering. All criteria are case sensitive.

hostContains.description: Matches if the host name of the URL contains a specified string. To test whether a host name component has a prefix 'foo', use hostContains: '.foo'. This matches 'www.foobar.com' and 'foo.com', because an implicit dot is added at the beginning of the host name. Similarly, hostContains can be used to match against component suffix ('foo.') and to exactly match against components ('.foo.'). Suffix- and exact-matching for the last components need to be done separately using hostSuffix, because no implicit dot is added at the end of the host name.

hostEquals.description: Matches if the host name of the URL is equal to a specified string.

hostPrefix.description: Matches if the host name of the URL starts with a specified string.

hostSuffix.description: Matches if the host name of the URL ends with a specified string.

originAndPathMatches.description: Matches if the URL without query segment and fragment identifier matches a specified regular expression. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

pathContains.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL contains a specified string.

pathEquals.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL is equal to a specified string.

pathPrefix.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL starts with a specified string.

pathSuffix.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL ends with a specified string.

ports.description: Matches if the port of the URL is contained in any of the specified port lists. For example [80, 443, [1000, 1200]] matches all requests on port 80, 443 and in the range 1000-1200.

choices.description: A pair of integers identiying the start and end (both inclusive) of a port range.

queryContains.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL contains a specified string.

queryEquals.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL is equal to a specified string.

queryPrefix.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL starts with a specified string.

querySuffix.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL ends with a specified string.

schemes.description: Matches if the scheme of the URL is equal to any of the schemes specified in the array.

urlContains.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) contains a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlEquals.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) is equal to a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlMatches.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) matches a specified regular expression. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

urlPrefix.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) starts with a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlSuffix.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) ends with a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

description: The chrome.extensionTypes API contains type declarations for Chrome extensions.

types.description: The format of an image.
Details about the format and quality of an image.

format.description: The format of the resulting image. Default is "jpeg".

quality.description: When format is "jpeg", controls the quality of the resulting image. This value is ignored for PNG images. As quality is decreased, the resulting image will have more visual artifacts, and the number of bytes needed to store it will decrease.

types.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab.
Details of the script or CSS to inject. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

allFrames.description: If allFrames is true, implies that the JavaScript or CSS should be injected into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and is only injected into the top frame. If true and frameId is set, then the code is inserted in the selected frame and all of its child frames.

code.description:
JavaScript or CSS code to inject.

Warning:
Be careful using the code parameter. Incorrect use of it may open your extension to cross site scripting attacks.

file.description: JavaScript or CSS file to inject.

frameId.description: The frame where the script or CSS should be injected. Defaults to 0 (the top-level frame).

matchAboutBlank.description: If matchAboutBlank is true, then the code is also injected in about:blank and about:srcdoc frames if your extension has access to its parent document. Code cannot be inserted in top-level about:-frames. By default it is false.

runAt.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

description: Use chrome.gcm to enable apps and extensions to send and receive messages through the Google Cloud Messaging Service.

events.description: Fired when a message is received through GCM.

parameters.description: A message received from another party via GCM.
parameters.name: message

collapseKey.description: The collapse key of a message. See Collapsible Messages section of Cloud Messaging documentation for details.

from.description: The sender who issued the message.

events.description: Fired when a GCM server had to delete messages sent by an app server to the application. See Messages deleted event section of Cloud Messaging documentation for details on handling this event.
events.name: onMessagesDeleted

events.description: Fired when it was not possible to send a message to the GCM server.
events.name: onSendError

parameters.description: An error that occured while trying to send the message either in Chrome or on the GCM server. Application can retry sending the message with a reasonable backoff and possibly longer time-to-live.
parameters.name: error

details.description: Additional details related to the error, when available.

errorMessage.description: The error message describing the problem.

messageId.description: The ID of the message with this error, if error is related to a specific message.

functions.description: Registers the application with GCM. The registration ID will be returned by the callback. If register is called again with the same list of senderIds, the same registration ID will be returned.
functions.name: register

parameters.description: A list of server IDs that are allowed to send messages to the application. It should contain at least one and no more than 100 sender IDs.
parameters.name: senderIds

parameters.description: Function called when registration completes. It should check $(ref:runtime.lastError) for error when registrationId is empty.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: A registration ID assigned to the application by the GCM.
parameters.name: registrationId

functions.description: Unregisters the application from GCM.
functions.name: unregister

parameters.description: A function called after the unregistration completes. Unregistration was successful if $(ref:runtime.lastError) is not set.
parameters.name: callback

functions.description: Sends a message according to its contents.
functions.name: send

parameters.description: A message to send to the other party via GCM.
parameters.name: message

data.description: Message data to send to the server. Case-insensitive goog. and google, as well as case-sensitive collapse_key are disallowed as key prefixes. Sum of all key/value pairs should not exceed $(ref:gcm.MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE).

destinationId.description: The ID of the server to send the message to as assigned by Google API Console.

messageId.description: The ID of the message. It must be unique for each message in scope of the applications. See the Cloud Messaging documentation for advice for picking and handling an ID.

timeToLive.description: Time-to-live of the message in seconds. If it is not possible to send the message within that time, an onSendError event will be raised. A time-to-live of 0 indicates that the message should be sent immediately or fail if it's not possible. The maximum and a default value of time-to-live is 86400 seconds (1 day).

parameters.description: A function called after the message is successfully queued for sending. $(ref:runtime.lastError) should be checked, to ensure a message was sent without problems.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: The ID of the message that the callback was issued for.
parameters.name: messageId

MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of all key/value pairs in a message.

description: Use the chrome.history API to interact with the browser's record of visited pages. You can add, remove, and query for URLs in the browser's history. To override the history page with your own version, see Override Pages.

events.description: Fired when a URL is visited, providing the HistoryItem data for that URL.  This event fires before the page has loaded.
events.name: onVisited

events.description: Fired when one or more URLs are removed from the history service.  When all visits have been removed the URL is purged from history.
events.name: onVisitRemoved

allHistory.description: True if all history was removed.  If true, then urls will be empty.

functions.description: Searches the history for the last visit time of each page matching the query.
functions.name: search

endTime.description: Limit results to those visited before this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.  Defaults to 100.

startTime.description: Limit results to those visited after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch. If not specified, this defaults to 24 hours in the past.

text.description: A free-text query to the history service.  Leave empty to retrieve all pages.

functions.description: Retrieves information about visits to a URL.
functions.name: getVisits

url.description: The URL for which to retrieve visit information.  It must be in the format as returned from a call to history.search.

functions.description: Adds a URL to the history at the current time with a transition type of "link".
functions.name: addUrl

url.description: The URL to add.

functions.description: Removes all occurrences of the given URL from the history.
functions.name: deleteUrl

url.description: The URL to remove.

functions.description: Removes all items within the specified date range from the history.  Pages will not be removed from the history unless all visits fall within the range.
functions.name: deleteRange

endTime.description: Items added to history before this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

startTime.description: Items added to history after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

functions.description: Deletes all items from the history.
functions.name: deleteAll

types.description: The transition type for this visit from its referrer.
An object encapsulating one result of a history query.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

lastVisitTime.description: When this page was last loaded, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

title.description: The title of the page when it was last loaded.

typedCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page by typing in the address.

visitCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page.

types.description: An object encapsulating one visit to a URL.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

referringVisitId.description: The visit ID of the referrer.

transition.description: The transition type for this visit from its referrer.

visitId.description: The unique identifier for this visit.

visitTime.description: When this visit occurred, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

description: Use the chrome.i18n infrastructure to implement internationalization across your whole app or extension.

description: Use the chrome.idle API to detect when the machine's idle state changes.

events.description: Fired when the system changes to an active, idle or locked state. The event fires with "locked" if the screen is locked or the screensaver activates, "idle" if the system is unlocked and the user has not generated any input for a specified number of seconds, and "active" when the user generates input on an idle system.

parameters.description: Threshold, in seconds, used to determine when the system is in an idle state.

description: Use the chrome.pageAction API to put icons in the main Google Chrome toolbar, to the right of the address bar. Page actions represent actions that can be taken on the current page, but that aren't applicable to all pages. Page actions appear grayed out when inactive.

events.description: Fired when a page action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the page action has a popup.
events.name: onClicked

functions.description: Shows the page action. The page action is shown whenever the tab is selected.
functions.name: show

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Hides the page action. Hidden page actions still appear in the Chrome toolbar, but are grayed out.
functions.name: hide

parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Sets the title of the page action. This is displayed in a tooltip over the page action.

functions.name: getTitle

tabId.description: Specify the tab to get the title from.

functions.description: Sets the icon for the page action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.
functions.name: setIcon

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).
