functions.description: Creates (opens) a new browser with any optional sizing, position or default URL provided.
functions.name: create

focused.description: If true, opens an active window. If false, opens an inactive window.

height.description: The height in pixels of the new window, including the frame. If not specified defaults to a natural height.

incognito.description: Whether the new window should be an incognito window.

left.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the left edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focused window. This value is ignored for panels.

state.description: The initial state of the window. The 'minimized', 'maximized' and 'fullscreen' states cannot be combined with 'left', 'top', 'width' or 'height'.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to adopt to the new window.

top.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the top edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focused window. This value is ignored for panels.

type.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create. The 'panel' and 'detached_panel' types create a popup unless the '--enable-panels' flag is set.

url.description: A URL or array of URLs to open as tabs in the window. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e. 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs will be relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

width.description: The width in pixels of the new window, including the frame. If not specified defaults to a natural width.

parameters.description: Contains details about the created window.
parameters.name: window

functions.description: Updates the properties of a window. Specify only the properties that you want to change; unspecified properties will be left unchanged.
functions.name: update

drawAttention.description: If true, causes the window to be displayed in a manner that draws the user's attention to the window, without changing the focused window. The effect lasts until the user changes focus to the window. This option has no effect if the window already has focus. Set to false to cancel a previous draw attention request.

focused.description: If true, brings the window to the front. If false, brings the next window in the z-order to the front.

height.description: The height to resize the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

left.description: The offset from the left edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

state.description: The new state of the window. The 'minimized', 'maximized' and 'fullscreen' states cannot be combined with 'left', 'top', 'width' or 'height'.

top.description: The offset from the top edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

width.description: The width to resize the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

functions.description: Removes (closes) a window, and all the tabs inside it.
functions.name: remove

WINDOW_ID_CURRENT.description: The windowId value that represents the current window.

WINDOW_ID_NONE.description: The windowId value that represents the absence of a chrome browser window.

types.description: The type of browser window this is. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned type property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.
The state of this browser window. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned state property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

alwaysOnTop.description: Whether the window is set to be always on top.

focused.description: Whether the window is currently the focused window.

height.description: The height of the window, including the frame, in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned height property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

id.description: The ID of the window. Window IDs are unique within a browser session. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned an ID, for example when querying windows using the $(ref:sessions) API, in which case a session ID may be present.

left.description: The offset of the window from the left edge of the screen in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned left property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

sessionId.description: The session ID used to uniquely identify a Window obtained from the $(ref:sessions) API.

state.description: The state of this browser window.

tabs.description: Array of $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects representing the current tabs in the window.

top.description: The offset of the window from the top edge of the screen in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned top property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

type.description: The type of browser window this is.

width.description: The width of the window, including the frame, in pixels. Under some circumstances a Window may not be assigned width property, for example when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

types.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create. The 'panel' and 'detached_panel' types create a popup unless the '--enable-panels' flag is set.

description: Use the chrome.accessibilityFeatures API to manage Chrome's accessibility features. This API relies on the ChromeSetting prototype of the type API for getting and setting individual accessibility features. In order to get feature states the extension must request accessibilityFeatures.read permission. For modifying feature state, the extension needs accessibilityFeatures.modify permission. Note that accessibilityFeatures.modify does not imply accessibilityFeatures.read permission.

enum.description: Images are allowed to animate.
enum.name: allowed

enum.description: Images are animated once.
enum.name: once

enum.description: Images are not animated.
enum.name: none

autoclick.description:
ChromeOS only.

Auto mouse click after mouse stops moving. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

caretHighlight.description:
ChromeOS only.

Caret highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

cursorHighlight.description:
ChromeOS only.

Cursor highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

focusHighlight.description:
ChromeOS only.

Focus highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

highContrast.description:
ChromeOS only.

High contrast rendering mode. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

largeCursor.description:
ChromeOS only.

Enlarged cursor. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

screenMagnifier.description:
ChromeOS only.

Full screen magnification. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

selectToSpeak.description:
ChromeOS only.

Select-to-speak. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

spokenFeedback.description:
ChromeOS only.

Spoken feedback (text-to-speech). The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

stickyKeys.description:
ChromeOS only.

Sticky modifier keys (like shift or alt). The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

switchAccess.description:
ChromeOS only.

Switch access. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

virtualKeyboard.description:
ChromeOS only.

Virtual on-screen keyboard. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

description: Use the chrome.fileBrowserHandler API to extend the Chrome OS file browser. For example, you can use this API to enable users to upload files to your website.

events.description: Fired when file system action is executed from ChromeOS file browser.
events.name: onExecute

parameters.description: File browser action id as specified in the listener component's manifest.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: File handler execute event details.
parameters.name: details

functions.description: Prompts user to select file path under which file should be saved. When the file is selected, file access permission required to use the file (read, write and create) are granted to the caller. The file will not actually get created during the function call, so function caller must ensure its existence before using it. The function has to be invoked with a user gesture.
functions.name: selectFile

parameters.description: Parameters that will be used while selecting the file.
parameters.name: selectionParams

allowedFileExtensions.description: List of file extensions that the selected file can have. The list is also used to specify what files to be shown in the select file dialog. Files with the listed extensions are only shown in the dialog. Extensions should not include the leading '.'. Example: ['jpg', 'png']

parameters.description: Function called upon completion.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: Result of the method.
parameters.name: result

entry.description: Selected file entry. It will be null if a file hasn't been selected.

success.description: Whether the file has been selected.

types.description: Event details payload for fileBrowserHandler.onExecute event.

entries.description: Array of Entry instances representing files that are targets of this action (selected in ChromeOS file browser).

tab_id.description: The ID of the tab that raised this event. Tab IDs are unique within a browser session.

description: Use the chrome.input.ime API to implement a custom IME for Chrome OS. This allows your extension to handle keystrokes, set the composition, and manage the candidate window.
